results.title: The Caterpillar and the polliwog
results.brief_description: When I grow up I’m going to turn into something else, the caterpillar boasts to her friends. When the polliwog discovers that he, too, will turn into something else, he tells the caterpillar, and off they go to change into butterflies. While the polliwog waits patiently for his friend to emerge from her cocoon, he doesn’t notice that he is changing too - but not into a butterfly. From the book by Jack Kent.

results.title: The Cat who drank and used too much
results.creator_credit: Timothy Armstrong, Yvonne Parsons, Randall Frederick and FMS Productions
results.brief_description: Featuring Pat the Cat, this rather clever film produced by the US Alcohol and Drug Foundation focuses on the damage caused by excess drinking and the availability of help and support through the Recovery Center. Pat the Cat starts drinking to excess, tries other substances, ignores his friends’ advice, crashes his car and is finally referred for recovery. Narrated by Julie Harris.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Timothy Armstrong, Yvonne Parsons, Randall Frederick and FMS Productions

results.title: The Cat returns = Neko no ongaeshi
results.creator_credit: Hiroyuki Morita, Nozomu Takahashi, Toshio Suzuki and Studio Ghibli
results.brief_description: Animated fantasy adventure about a young high school girl, Haru, who finds herself being rewarded for a good deed carried out as a child. She simply feeds a hungry kitten but when this unique kitten grows, it is decided in the cat kingdom that Haru is special and should be given gifts. Daughter of a single mother, the young girl has the usual teenage angst and wants to impress the handsome boy in her class. Her usual routine is forgotten however as she is transported to the Kingdom of Cats. Haru also unwittingly finds herself engaged to the Prince of Cats! A coming-of-age film with a difference as this is a magical and fantastic adventure suitable for family viewing. From the creators of award winning “Spirited Away” [318123] the moving classical soundtrack adds to the enchanting nature of the story.
